# Euler Problem 8 Solution in C#

## Problem Statement
Find the greatest product of fifty consecutive digits in the 1000-digit number.

## Solution

```csharp
using System;
using System.Numerics;

class Program
{
    static void Main()
    {
        // The 1000-digit number as a string
        string number = @"73167176531330624919225119674426574742355349194934
96983520312774506326239578318016984801869478851843
85861560789112949495459501737958331952853208805511
12540698747158523863050715693290963295227443043557
66896648950445244523161731856403098711121722383113
62229893423380308135336276614282806444486645238749
30358907296290491560440772390713810515859307960866
70172427121883998797908792274921901557131982468134
82134020418308440341101106728157011205422582123322
16373630142518112050321861685448052100119438360120
32410423580331500311250363430742783110260422300342
20255026278272913230124345294016457353053481778200
17204125609318130476550421348434060432611302145615
21360325354056482732066521332351810626411840913363
04305501530814353632882102332012663253461034601182
96080436311800123230224051630712311644534212312442
02011033234130498755465181301231220632317541018440
76133332170113206416254583406467412266022410309864
42246185166342076048112451603401220626446583316203
11415084337206332268562344032030461793713116315117
12510322137603586012621326608450441124383406534601
61784624706246784362281715106424420201905341082167
15280172424230526636464206230033716034246210433800
22655920863351222113405220355243048205926156480022
06192614135250662021442702096233619484848200435431
41513210342210374118628657215112420930186513001448
10052024850380081618611365128380121332425436445684
32460263443213141013245331206531618082865466221616
34334361443311813122134043788617356166020624340633
25020153031230301331005322020106414404305245143410
04863521621242582022202634044801310410158224172412
89611341210415800626190415541505436369420421382882
25005132441886410505466534641322316424387428105465
12311666360605932326115341513613506981355412986614
24465254141761328263682121212121212121212121212121
21212121212121212121212121212121212121212121212121
21212121212121212121212121212121212121212121212121
21212121212121212121212121212121212121212121212121
21212121212121212121212121212121212121212121212121";

        int consecutiveDigits = 50;
        BigInteger maxProduct = 0;

        // Loop through each possible sequence of 50 consecutive digits
        for (int i = 0; i <= number.Length - consecutiveDigits; i++)
        {
            BigInteger product = 1;
            
            // Calculate the product of 50 consecutive digits
            for (int j = 0; j < consecutiveDigits; j++)
            {
                int digit = int.Parse(number[i + j].ToString());
                product *= digit;
            }
            
            // Update maximum product if current product is larger
            if (product > maxProduct)
                maxProduct = product;
        }

        Console.WriteLine($"The greatest product of {consecutiveDigits} consecutive digits is: {maxProduct}");
    }
}
```

## Explanation

1. **Data Input**: The 1000-digit number is stored as a multi-line string for easy reading and management.

2. **Algorithm**: 
   - We iterate through each possible starting position for a sequence of 50 consecutive digits
   - For each sequence, we calculate the product of all 50 digits
   - We keep track of the maximum product found

3. **Key Considerations**:
   - Since the product can be very large (up to 9^50), we use `BigInteger` from `System.Numerics`
   - We handle the edge case where we don't have enough digits at the end of the string
   - The loop runs from index 0 to `number.Length - consecutiveDigits` to ensure we don't go out of bounds

4. **Time Complexity**: O(n Ã— k) where n is the length of the number and k is the number of consecutive digits (50)

The solution will output the greatest product of fifty consecutive digits in the given 1000-digit number.
